parsed.internal_thinking: I've placed my first settlement on node 20, which gives me access to Wood (11), Brick (6), and Sheep (8). Now I need to place my road. Looking at the neighbors of node 20 (10, 19, 21), node 10 is the most attractive direction. Moving towards node 10 allows me to reach node 11 (Brick 6, Sheep 5, Wood 12) for a total of 10 pips, or node 9 which is a 3:1 port. This expansion path reinforces my access to Brick and Sheep, which are essential for early-game road building and settlements. The other directions (19 and 21) lead to lower-yield nodes and don't offer immediate port access. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Placed road towards node 10. Planning to expand to node 11 or the 3:1 port at node 9. Need to find Ore/Wheat for the second settlement.
parsed.say_outloud: pointing this road up towards the port, seems like a good direction to expand.
